info.title: AQS Data API
info.description:
These are the specifications for the AQS API version 2. Remaining to do 
 * Add more services
  * Verify return descriptions are correct

contact.name: US EPA Air Quality System API v2

externalDocs.description: Find out more about the Open API Specification

tags.name: qaAnnualPerformanceEvaluations
tags.description: Returns pairs of data (known and measured values) at several concentration levels

tags.name: list
tags.description: Returns lists of valid values for data entry elsewhere

tags.name: available
tags.description: Ping to see if system is on-line

tags.name: qaFlowRateAudits
tags.description: Returns QA flow rate audit data

tags.name: qaFlowRateVerifications
tags.description: Returns QA flow rate verification data

tags.name: qaOnePointQcRawData
tags.description: Returns QA one point QC raw data

tags.name: metaData
tags.description: Returns meta data for a service

tags.name: transactionsSample
tags.description: Returns data in AQS transaction format

tags.name: transactionsQaAnnualPerformanceEvaluations
tags.description: Returns pairs of data QA at several concentration levels in the submission (transaction) format for AQS

paramParam.name: param
paramParam.description: Parameter code.  Enter a 5-digit AQS parameter code  (or multiple codes separated by commas).  Example 44201,88101,88502. Use the list/parametersByClass service for valid parameter codes. (e.g., https://aqs.epa.gov/data/api/list/parametersByClass?email=test@aqs.api&key=test&pc=CRITERIA)

optionalParam.name: param
optionalParam.description: Parameter code.  Enter a 5-digit AQS parameter code  (or multiple codes separated by commas).  Example 44201,88101,88502. Use the list/parametersByClass service for valid parameter codes. (e.g., https://aqs.epa.gov/data/api/list/parametersByClass?email=test@aqs.api&key=test&pc=CRITERIA)

stateParam.name: state
stateParam.description: State FIPS code - must be two digits including leading zero  Use the list/states service for a list of state codes (e.g., https://aqs.epa.gov/data/api/list/states?email=test@aqs.api&key=test).

countyParam.name: county
countyParam.description: County FIPS code - must be three digits including leading zeroes.

siteParam.name: site
siteParam.description: Site number - must be four digits including leading zeroes.

pocParam.name: poc
pocParam.description: Parameter Occurrence Code - the monitor number.

CBSAParam.name: cbsa
CBSAParam.description: CBSA code - must be five digits including leading zeroes.  Use list/cbsas to find the CSA codes.

minlatParam.name: minlat
minlatParam.description: Minimum Latitude - the southernmost extent of a bounding box query.

maxlatParam.name: maxlat
maxlatParam.description: Maximum Latitude - the northernmost extent of a bounding box query.

minlonParam.name: minlon
minlonParam.description: Minimum Longitude - the westernmost extent of a bounding box query. Use negative values for the western hemisphere.  And -70 is less than -60.

maxlonParam.name: maxlon
maxlonParam.description: Maximum Longitude - the westernmost extent of a bounding box query. Use negative values for the western hemisphere.

bdateParam.name: bdate
bdateParam.description: Begin date of data (YYYYMMDD).  For example 20100101.

edateParam.name: edate
edateParam.description: End date of data (YYYYMMDD).  For example 20101231.

cbdateParam.name: cbdate
cbdateParam.description: Beginning of window to look for changed data (YYYYMMDD).  For example,  to get data for 2010 that last changed in March of 2011, use these parameters. bdate = 20100101, edate = 20101231, cbdate = 20110301, cedate = 20110331.

cedateParam.name: cedate
cedateParam.description: End of window to look for changed data (YYYYMMDD).  For example,  to get data for 2010 that last changed in March of 2011, use these parameters. bdate = 20100101, edate = 20101231, cbdate = 20110301, cedate = 20110331.

pqaoParam.name: pqao
pqaoParam.description: Code for the primary quality assurance organization - up to 4 digits

agencyParam.name: agency
agencyParam.description: Code for the monitoring agency - up to 4 digits

get.summary: Returns a list of state codes
get.description: AQS uses FIPS codes for identifying states and counties.  This service provides the code for each state.  Note, when using a code _always_ include leading zeroes.

get.summary: Returns a list of county codes in the provided state
get.description: AQS uses FIPS codes for identifying states and counties.  This service provides the code for each county in a given state.  Note, when using a code _always_ include leading zeroes.

get.summary: Returns a list of site numbers in the given county
get.description: Each site (monitoring station) within a county has a unique 4 digit number.  This service provides a list of all sites within the given county.  The leading zeroes are part of the site number and the numbers do not have to be sequential.

get.summary: Returns a list of CBSA (metro area) codes
get.description: AQS uses Census codes for identifying metro areas (CBSAs, or Core Based Statistical Areas).   This service provides the code for each CBSA.   Note, when using a code _always_ include leading zeroes.

get.summary: Returns a list of classes (groups) of parameters
get.description: This service returns the list of AQS parameter classes.  A parameter class is a grouping of parameters, like Criteria or Meteorological.

get.summary: Returns a list of parameter codes in the provided class.  "ALL" is a valid class.
get.description: Returns a list of parameter codes in the provided class.  "ALL" is a valid class that will return all AQS parameters.  The parameter codes in AQS are specific to the system.  We cannot use CAS or other schemes because they do not provide a direct mapping to measurements reported to AQS.

get.summary: Returns a list of primary quality assurance organization codes
get.description: Returns a list of primary quality assurance organization codes.

get.summary: Returns a list of monitoring agency codes
get.description: Returns a list of monitoring agency codes.

Request an account by providing an email address
get.description: Service will send an email to the provided address with verification link and password.

get.summary: Ping to see if the service is working
get.description: This service returns the timestamp if the system is available.

SuccessfulRequest.description: Successful request.  A JSON object is returned.  There are two arrays in the returned object.  First is a Header array that contains one object with a summary information about the request.  Second is a Data array that will contain an object for each 'row' of returned data.  Specific schemas for each data object can be viewed by using the _metaData/fieldsByService_ service.

ServiceNotFound.description: The requested service was not found.  The endpoint is correct but there is likely a typo in the specific service name.  A JSON object with a header array containing a specific error is returned.

BadRequest.description: Bad request. Some of the query criteria (variables or values) entered are invalid.  A JSON object with a header array containing a specific error is returned.  If you did not receive a specific error (some browsers trap 400 responses), things to check include: all required query parameters have been included; the date formats are correct (YYYYMMDD with no punctuation); codes have been used where expected (e.g., state code, duration code).

SystemError.description: Internal error.  We are experiencing unexpected problems. Please send an email to aqsdatamart@epa.gov to let us know about the problem. Provide as much information a you can.  Particularly helpful are the request URL and the time of the request.

SystemDown.description: Our API is down.  We have weekly scheduled maintenance Sundays from 1800 - 2359 eastern standard time (GMT-5).  If you are getting this message outside that time window,  we are experiencing unexpected problems.  You may check our news feed at http://www3.epa.gov/airquality/airdata/rssairdata.xml  or email aqsdatamart@epa.gov for additional information.
